channel.title: The Windows 8 Review/nitpick Thread
channel.description:
Ok so windows 8 was released in the last few days and there are a lot of mixed reviews so I would like to see the opinions of the people of this forum. I myself unfortunately upgraded (if its even called upgrading) to windows 8 and have found myself completely lost as to where things are and I am pretty tech savvy having just graduated from an IT course this past June. 8 seems to be lacking some of the key features that every version of windows has had to date and that bothers me i should have done some research first.
I find this operating system quite cool looking but that's just about it so far for me. I am having a lot of trouble with video after the upgrade my games work flawless maybe even better but I cant seem to play the simplest videos without them skipping and stuttering. I also noticed a lot of things are opening just a bit quicker but the windows themselves seem to lag when I move them around and I shouldn't be getting that with the system I have.
If anyone has any type of review or nitpick and maybe even a solution to some of the issues you may have had whether they are the same or different then mine I would like to see it
My Specs: Windows 8 64 Bit :fffuuu: Core i7 920 @2.67GHz EVGA X58 Le Motherboard 2x BFG Geforce 280 in Sli 24 GB of Kingston Hyperx Ram 60GB Solid State Drive for operating system
If there has already been a thread dedicated to the release of windows 8 by all means a mod can move this thread to its respectful location!

item.title: The Windows 8 Review/nitpick Thread
item.dc:creator: Llewen_Ebag
item.description:
I have to say, Windows 8 does run stuff better than Win7. BF3 runs like a charm now with everything on ultra.

Read full topic

item.title: The Windows 8 Review/nitpick Thread
item.dc:creator: Dragunov2
item.description:
ChancyWancy:

I’d like to get the Windows 8 Metro UI with Windows 7 functionality. I’m sure there’s a theme out there for that.

EDIT: Found It

Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: The Windows 8 Review/nitpick Thread
item.dc:creator: E-Nelson
item.description:
I work on windows 8 machines now in my job and I’m very displeased from a productivity point of view. I will not be “upgrading.”

Read full topic

item.title: The Windows 8 Review/nitpick Thread
item.dc:creator: Llewen_Ebag
item.description:
Kamikal:

It’s Microsoft. They don’t seem to realize anything they do wrong.

Random, off-topic fun fact: My brother’s XBox has Red-Ringed 23 times, with no faults to it whatsoever. Microsoft are evil.

Then the red rings… red ringed?

I did try a bit when my brother beta tested the thing. It was on early beta so it was weird as all hell.

Read full topic

item.title: The Windows 8 Review/nitpick Thread
item.dc:creator: ChancyWancy
item.description:
I’d like to get the Windows 8 Metro UI with Windows 7 functionality. I’m sure there’s a theme out there for that.

EDIT: Found It

Read full topic

item.title: The Windows 8 Review/nitpick Thread
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Assuming Microsoft doesn’t start seeping into only touchscreen-based/oriented OSs, I think I’ll wait to upgrade until the NEXT Windows version. Maybe they’re realize they stepped on too many toes with this one.

Read full topic

item.title: The Windows 8 Review/nitpick Thread
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I’ve read nothing but negative reviews about Windows 8, from the fact that there are 2 internet explorers, control panels, windows update centers and only one way to shut down your computer, using hidden gestures.

And Windows RT on an official microsoft tablet is reportedly incapable of keeping up with a human typing in Word, and brings up a login screen loop when trying to save a document. (when you log-in successfully the login screen shows up again, without saving your document)

If you want to keep your desktop or laptop easy to use, stay AWAY from windows 8.

Read full topic

item.title: The Windows 8 Review/nitpick Thread
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
I’m pretty broke, so I can’t upgrade, but I did use that preview thing they had months ago. I liked it. Sure, the lack of the old start menu was irritating, but the replacement wasn’t terrible. It seemed more or less like modified Win7, to me. But then again, that was the preview, so the full version may differ.

Read full topic

item.title: The Windows 8 Review/nitpick Thread
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
I’ve been hearing a lot that Windows RT is quite good, but that Windows 8 is more or less pointless for desktop users. I’m interested in trying an RT tablet now after reading anandtech’s review, but I don’t think I’ll be upgrading my desktop to 8.

Read full topic
